It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and its distinctive, elongated bracts that enclose the flower cluster. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in an umbel, which are often surrounded by showy, leaf-like bracts. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
